Top Notch!

Even though this game is 5 years old it's very entertaining. I first thought this is a simple left for dead copy,  but I was wrong. Killing floor is like a mix of PayDay (Level system, playstyle) and  Left for dead ( zombie genre and enemy diversity). It has its own charm. When i played it first time i thought "Beginner" difficulty is way to weak and i should go for hard ....woah was I wrong. Beginner may be realy easy but normal is already quite hard to survive and hard is realy hard... I still havent managed to win a Hell on Earth mission and suicidental is damn hard. Its realy important in this game for the higher difficulties where to stay/camp or run; to know from where the enemy comes from and to play as a team + experience of your team overall. Good aiming, Teamwork and personal character level is important in this game. I highly recommend this game for all people who like alien swam, payday, left 4 dead or any other good coop fps games, who haven't played this game and are looking for some challenge/fun (naturaly u can have both if u want - depends on your character).

Não é o melhor jogo de zumbi da Steam, de forma alguma, é bom, no minimo razovel, os gráficos deixam a desejar em alguns momentos, a liberdade também, o modo multiplayer apresenta muitos problemas, e alguns bugs podem ser vistos durante as partidas.

6/10 - É um bom jogo, que te deixa tenso e as vezes com medo, mas como eu já disse, não vale a pena gastar R$24,99 reais fora da promoção para pega-lo.
отличный командный шутер с галоннами крови, тоннами мяса и полными штанами радости

[h1]Review powered by [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/mamilosclub]Mamilos Club Group.[/url][/h1]

[b]Killing Floor[/b] foi, e ainda é, uma experiência que guardarei por muito tempo. É um jogo de estilo [i]FPS / Gore[/i], atendeu as espectativas dos fãns e ainda atenderá dos futuros jogadores.

O jogo é em primeira pessoa, na qual seu enredo se passa em Londres - Inglaterra. Um de seus modos de Jogo, é lutar contra ondas de ZEDs e no final enfrentar o chefe Patriarch. Há outro modo de jogo, que é o modo Objetivo; como o nome sugere, você tem que completar os objetivos do mapa.

Os jogadores podem escolher um dentre sete Perks (Classes), que dão bônus ao jogador com determinado tipo de arma, dano, precisão ... Dentre outros. O nível máximo de cada Perk é 6, sendo que a dificuldade para se upar aumenta a cada nível.

O jogo tem 5 tipos de dificuldade. Mostrarei cada um e seus respectivos níveis de Perk.
- Easy Mode: Perk Lvl 0 - Lvl 6
- Normal Mode: Perk Lvl 0 - Lvl 6
- Hard Mode: Perk Lvl 3 - Lvl 6
- Suicidal Mode: Perk Lvl 5 - Lvl 6
- Hell on Earth Mode: Perk Lvl 6
[i]Estes são as minhas recomendações, para incrementar a velocidade de se upar, e para sobreviver em cada partida.[/i]

[h1]Q.A[/h1]

Q: Killing Floor é um jogo de Zumbi?
A: [i]Não. De acordo com a história do Killing Floor, eles são frutos de alterações genéticas.[/i]

Q: O jogo tem mods e mapas na Workshop?
A: [i]Sim. Há vários servidores customizados com Mods.[/i]

Q: Vale a pena comprar?
A: [i]Por mim vale, mas se você estiver achando o preço um pouco salgado, espere uma promoção.[/i]

Q: Em uma partida comum, quantos jogadores podem ficar em uma mesma sala?
A: [i]Em servidores normais, 6 pessoas ao total. No caso de servidores com mods, ja vi servidores com até 30 pessoas simultaneamente.[/i]

[h1]+Pros[/h1]

+Jogabilidade
+Mapas
+Workshop

[h1]-Cons[/h1]

-Gráficos ultrapassados
-Abandono da produtora, sem atualizações e/ou correção de possíveis Bugs
-Nâo possúi tradução para PT-BR

-The only improvement I could add is probably add more weapons that range at different prices, but also maybe improvements on graphics to imply an even scarier atmosphere.

Joguei, Joguei nem senti medo u.u #ArgumentoDesnecessário . This game is a lot of fun. There are regular seasonal updates as well to keep it interesting. 

This is a co-op survival horror fps. Great for those who don't want to compete with grinders. At least you work together instead of getting pwned nonstop. 

Lots of sardonic humor here and the game doesn't take itself too seriously. Another big plus is this is regularly on sale on Steam. It's also easy to play and adapt to. This is one of those games you can play for hours on end and get a lot of bang for your buck. When it gets old there is usually a seasonal change so it's always fun to pick it up again. Even if you aren't a hardcore FPS gamer you will probably enjoy this because you can play on easy servers with others and it isn't very competitive unlike almost every other shooter on the market. 5 years after it's release this is still a must have.

Ahhh, Killing Floor, where do I begin?

Back during the christmas steam sale of 2013 my friends and I decided to get this game when it went on sale. Back then we just thought, hey it's a multiplayer game, and it looks pretty cool. We never thought we would sink as much time into this game as we have.

It used to hang at the initial load up screen for ages, but even then it worth the 2 minutes of black screen to wait to play this game, the gameplay its self is addictive and enjoyable, the leveling system is a bit too high on the grinding curve if you ask me, once you get to level 4 in the different classes it just drags. I am stoked to see what the next game will bring to the table.

Also, what is up with the dialogue, specifically with the trader? Why does she say things like;

I like the big ones, don't you?
The shop is open, boys; come get me!
They're all dead! It's time to go shoppin'!
Come and get 'em! Lovely big guns!
I'll tool you up, just right.

4 of the 5 of those dialogues are definitly spoken with a naughty overtone of sorts, i'm not complaining by any means, at this point its a great joke between my friends and I quoting her and laughing. Anyways, you won't regret getting it, and I am looking forward to Killing Floor 2.

Les jeux de zombies, on en a vu des dizaines, que dis-je, des centaines, tous plus répétitifs les uns que les autres. Mais celui-là est... la définition même du contraire de la subtilité! Vous voulez, du sang, du CAC, et du massacre? Killing floor répond à cela en vous offrand un gros plateau de zombies et beaucoup d'armes pour tous les faucher! Ce jeu est un gros défouloir : bien entendu il y a les armes traditionnelles, mais pour plus de fun il y a les lances patate, et surtout les katanas et claymores! Si vous voulez cependant finir une map en mod normal ou plus il va falloir jouer avec d'autres joueurs parce que même si certaines maps sont immenses, lorsque vous êtes à court de munitions et que vous êtes seul, byebye c'est game over! Donc du bourrinage certes, mais surtout beaucoup de co-op. Et pour revenir sur l'aspect carnage du jeu, quoi de mieux que de flinguer une bestiole en plein dans les airs après qu'elle se soit pris une grenade l'ayant projettée, et ceci en slow motion? Oui il y a beaucoup de slow motion ce qui peut vous sauver la vie ou tous simplement rendre la situation dans laquelle vous vous trouvez très classe. 

Donc pour faire court : carnage, ralentis, et prenez-le! (il est souvent en promo à 4€ et quelques profitez en!)

Eu sou suspeito para analisar o KF, para mim só é o jogo cooperativo de hordas mais incrível que já joguei...

O slow motion quando você mutila os inimigos e a trilha sonora composta de batidas pesadas de Rock e Metal dar uma adrenalina do C-A-R-A-L-H-O.

Mesmo sendo um jogo bem antigo eu recomendo muito, o game é barato e se você pegar numa promoção boa da Steam, pode pegar o pacote completo que vem com todas as skins de personagens e armas.

O jogo tem 7 classes que são chamados de "Perks" cada um com as suas vantagens e armas para cada estilo de jogo.

Por tanto recomendo ter colegas para jogar que aumentará a diversão em dobro, mas se caso for um forever alone, você pode por para procurar partidas online que até hoje são bem ativas.

Tem diversos mods que você pode baixar para melhorar sua experiência, de mapas, skins, hud, tradução, umas bem zoeiras e assim vai...

O jogo tem seu desafio principalmente nas dificuldades mais altas forçando a jogar em conjunto com seu time e qualquer vacilo é um abraço._.

Enfim para mim ele é perfeito, só me falta pessoas/colegas para jogar Ç.Ç
Игра просто супер рекомендую всем поиграть!

Heureux possesseur de Killing Floor depuis sa sortie, si vous aimez tuer du zombie, jouer en équipe, où tout simplement survivre dans un jeux-video je vous conseille Killing Floor. 

Le jeu a su évoluer dans le temps, tout d'abord en rajoutant un niveau (6 niveaux disponible par classe, au lieu de 5 au lancement du jeu), des events (tel que Halloween ou Noël, voir l'été qui chacun ont des monstres différents), des nouvelles maps (en rapport avec les events, ou tout simplement des map officielles rajoutées), et des events d'histoire qui nous dirigent tout doucement vers la sortie du 2ème opus. 

Le jeu est graphiquement normal, fait son âge mais reste jouable, la communautée est encore bien peuplée, et il reste actuellement beaucoup de serveurs pour jouer. Au niveau de la difficultée, il y'a 5 mode de difficultées différents (Easy, Normal, Hard, Suicidal, HoE), biensûr plus la difficultée va augmentée, plus un jeu d'équipe sera nécessaire.

Le scénario est quasi réduit à néant, le but ultime est de survivre aux vagues de zombies, pour au final tuer le Patriarch.

Si vous cherchez un jeu de zombie pas très cher, avec des MAJ gratuites, du fun, du teamplay, et du défis, n'hésitez pas.

After playing a Christmas themed level, where the happy tune of Jingle Bells plays, I can easily say that Killing zombies has never been more joyful. Mind you, this is just one of the many maps included in the base game. I would not want to spoil the rest of the game, but if you're at all feeling any doubt about this game, I strongly urge you to buy it. Because it's not just a zombie game. 

It's a crazy mass murdering psychotic bloodfest of demented toys, chainsaw equipped maniacs, and many more that I'm sure I haven't encountered as of yet. Now, this game is strictly a multiplayer experience that is meant to be enjoyed with friends, but if you're so inclined, you can have a solo experience as well.(I often prefer the 'lone wolf' experience myself)

This is however not by any means an experience like Left 4 Dead. You do not simply mow through enemies with the "Yeah, I'm a tough guy" approach. The zombies are challenging, and they WILL catch you off guard. They will give you a merciless beating, should they get too close. But that's what makes it so addicting. It's something that you need to practice. This game offers the biggest arsenal of weaponry that once you attain it, you will feel like you're invincible. But you could not be any more wrong. Every wave gets tougher and tougher, but that's the beauty of it. To see just how far you can make it. Oh yeah, and there's no crosshair. It's skillful gunplay its best. But boy, those lucky gory headshots make practice all the more worth it. Good luck!
